bow: anyone here lose lot of friends after having baby feeling kind of alone had my sweetie 10 months ago and it been great however lot of my friends don really come around very much anymore and when they do they make comments about how he cries too much and other similar comments which honestly kind of hurts since he acts like normal baby was the first in our friend group to have baby and lot of them don understand any tips on making mom friends anyone else go through this as well he cries too much but he is baby good lord your friends sound challenged did find my friendships kind of waned also being the only one with children though ve yet to make mom friends and have 15mo and 3mo but go to playgroup center atleast once or twice week in hopes that evantually will be friend somebody young mom at that so it can be hard hang in there and maybe try seeing if there are groups around you even through facebook you may be able to connect with moms in the area my friendship with other new moms increased and some of my other friendships have dropped off think it just the reality of having kids versus not having kids yeah don talk to them very much anymore was pretty upset after that comment haha hoping can find some new mom friends trying to hang out with coworkers who just had babies go to as many mommy baby groups as you can and try to interact with as many of the moms there as you can try to get to know them and if you like them take the initiative to swap numbers or make plans to do stuff with the kids also any classes you can do with the baby like swimming lessons will get you interacting with more parents there also an app called peanut which is like tinder but for making mom friends didn have any luck with it in my area but you could give it shot it hard definitely has been transition especially missing some of my old friends my best friend keeps making plans to come see me then flakes out last minute or just does show up she keeps getting pissy that ca come to her place but do have car my boyfriend could drive but it an awful lot of transportation with month old baby he also works full time feel like always her last priority or not priority at all do get me wrong not asking to be number one priority it just really sucks to spend the whole day excited and then end up crying because she texts me an hour after she was supposed to come oops sorry forgot have to be the one to invite her over but she only ever visits for about 10 20 minutes before saying she has other people to meet up with she was never like this before my baby feel like our friendship is basically over feel like people without children don understand how hard it is to load up baby and haul all of the baby supplies over to their house of course don mind alternating houses to go see someone but at least make an effort to come over here once in while it hard for us mommas lol and yes feel like my friendship with some of my friends are basically over too they barely even reply to me anymore ll try that out thanks it horrible huh we my partner and lost touch with few friends they just didn understand that baby comes first and that babies are pretty full on and time energy consuming our little guy is now and pretty much all of those that drifted away have returned since having kids of their own we were the first too now that they first hand understand how hard it was is they make the effort to stay in touch partly coz hopefully anyway they missed us and because they had the same happen to them get out to every and all mums groups you can you ll start seeing the same other mums and then new friendships appear one hint everyone everyone pretty much everyone is in the same situation oh sweetheart could have written this my best friend has seen me since the end of december every time we talk she rambles on about her life in the city then asks me what doing outside of parenting then gets bored after minutes because my life is nothing but parenting ve given up if honest yep lost pretty much all of them if your friends have problem with your baby were they ever really friends to begin with maybe some will need time to adjust but those people will continue to make an effort regardless the others you are probably better off letting them drop off anyway hang in there same here my friends haven complained about my baby but they don have kids so they do things that aren kid friendly making it next to impossible for me to go it been so long since could go to bar with them that just stopped getting invited there mom app called peanut it like tinder but for finding mom friends didn have any luck with it since don live in very populated area but maybe worth shot my only mom friend is girl barely knew in high school we follow each other on instagram and throughout my pregnancy she dm me asking how was doing took leap and asked if she wanted to get together with the babies and she was glad to think lot of moms especially new moms are in the same boat and are happy if another mom engages with them have childfree friend who does not mind other kids but wo have her own completely supportive always have been of her choice she only hangs out if am without ds and flakes out of gatherings where he will be there did not expect that to hurt as much as it does as for the rest of my friends group well we are the last to have kid so there has been change of who we hang out with so much as how much we hang out with them removed oh yeah was also one of the first in my friend group they slowly started coming back when they had kids yup also noticed it only gets worse too once your baby is older and you can get away for day evening you would think your friends would want to meet up then and they still do it sucks think they are just opportunistic friends really wanted to just hang out with me when it was fun for them only so no probably am better off it sucks though mourning those relationships thank you internet hugs to you new momma we had something similar happen to us and miss being able to talk with my best friend my husband and were wondering if anyone else had this problem we have people that came to our wedding and us theirs but still have seen our now month old baby in few months we have trip planned for an out of state wedding and even though ve shared hotels etc with my best friend countless times over the years my big refused to share an airbnb with us she said she did want to be woken up by crying baby but our guy sleeps hours straight at night and get up to breastfeed him before he cries she would know that if we hung out more but she always has something going on are people scared of babies oh yes my best friend of 16 years she claimed she wanted to be around she wanted my son to know who she is but never actually wanted to do anything she complained about just hanging out at my house me having to stick to his routine and how we can do stuff we used to he only 13 months old don know what she expected he won know her if she doesn come over to play with him she gets mad that don want to pack him and all his stuff up to go over to her house which isn baby proofed he into everything it not safe stage of life issue and don fault them except for your friend comment about crying you just have less in common and don do the same things hopefully you can reconnect as they have kids mine are now getting older so don spend as much time with parents of younger kids just because mine play with older kids different group and my oldest is almost in college now so my group of friends is now partly those with kids out of the house we all need tribe that in our life stage who really understands and can support us and that may fluctuate mom groups are so fantastic in the littles stage feel you my friendship with one of my besties is basically over too when my daughter was newborn she and her husband would offer to babysit and practically guilt us into bringing our baby over even when we did want or need babysitter but they would babysit at their house not ours so we would have to lug all our baby stuff over to their house instead of them just coming over to ours and then when they would ask to come visit the baby they would show up hours late while we had been waiting for them to show up on time and of course when they do show up its nap time and they wanted to play with baby so crankiness ensued felt extra annoyed especially because my friend claims to have taken care of so many babies but did make any effort to make it easier on new parents by showing up on time its been year now and ve realized the friendship has been so one sided for years stopped texting her to see if she would ever text me and she has so amp x200b people grow up at different rates and friendships ebb and flow took it as an opportunity to become closer with friends who wanted to be around me in my new stage of life and make new mommy friends from daycare amp x200b hugs to you damn some people are assholes you know how they say you do know how many people you hate until you have to name baby guess the same goes for after you have baby too you do know how many people are true friends yes our friends would guilt us into letting them babysit we did have or want to go anywhere we wanted to stay home and spend time with our baby but they guilted us and we reluctantly say yes and then they would have us bring everything to their house what would it be easier for the adult to just come alone to where the baby crib toys food diapers etc are yes and no ve developed closer relationships to other friends who also have kids so think it been net gain for me yes and then she got mad at me for going to local restaurant with another friend because **that friend asked me to** she said would never do that for her what does that even mean yep it was one of the reasons went back to therapy when my daughter was around year old was pretty devastated to see how quickly felt forgotten by friends that had for in some cases few decades think most people without kids are unaware of and annoyed by the extent to which young child dictates your schedule they just want you to be able to behave however you did before the kid came and although don think kid needs to change everything about your life the reality is that small children needs trump your own so you ve got few years of kind of catering to them had friends who were just absolutely unwilling to work with my new boundaries like can talk on the phone any night but it has to be after the baby goes to bed at pm or can go out basically any weekend but need to schedule it ahead of time so know for sure my husband is available to hang out with the baby have friend who will call on her way home from work at pm or friend who will text that she at the local brewery and should drop by and then when can just answer the phone or drop by the brewery right then they see it as rejection and either get annoyed or just stop trying to reach out it sounds like your friend is insecure about your relationship with her and is jealous that you went out to dinner with someone else and she has to keep coming over to your house feel like like the best friends are always ok with just coming over and doing nothing sorry you have to deal with this silliness also lost friends with my son but have become closer to people with kids find family friendly places to take him to interact with other kids and dont be afraid to start conversation with other moms you will have plenty of new mom friends in no time my son is almost two lost almost all my friends without children however ve had about friends have babies since and guess who comes crawling back to hangout once all their childless friends bail on them when you have kids your priorities change and friends that aren parents don get it find few good mom friends and that all you need removed after got pregnant with never saw my maid of honor in person again lost over half my friends when had my oldest it sucked lot but made new friends at the breastfeeding center the botanical gardens new moms talk and the park so my advice is to look for new moms groups or get togethers and go with grain of salt better to search for events that catch your interest that you can also take the baby to it also good idea to just go to your local playground at set times to hang out it great way to meet other parents and get to know your neighborhood when my oldest went to kindergarten she already knew kids in her class from the park never really had friends to begin with feel like ve made more friends now that ever had before feel this hard had twins in october and didn go back to work feel like only have one friend who cares enough to visit see me the rest have given me lame excuses the worst is that lot of them are parents but to older kids so while thought see them more and they get it seems like if you re not in it you don care anymore 🤷🏻‍♀️ carve out time to go see my friends without the baby around which has helped dont get me wrong my friends love my son but they also love boozy brunches so once or twice month my husband does dad duty and can go have happy hour or get mimosas and pedicures relationships go both ways and in order for them to work you have to make sure that both parties are contributing equally so my friends come hang out and play with my son we can eat pizza or do whatever but respect that also need to show interest in their lives and go get dinner at that new trendy restaurant or play trivia at the bar we dont see each other nearly as much but our relationships have stayed just as strong as before children moms club nonprofit org based on location if you email national they will help you find your closest chapter if it isn obvious online mops hike it baby meetup com moms group find an existing one or make your own story time at the library baby and me swim classes and facebook moms groups my child less friends still see on occasion for dinner or group events but it is very hard because it whole different mindset if you have social media you can try to comment on other people kids pictures and maybe mentioning something along the lines of we should get together for play date sometime people you were just acquaintances with before may become closer friends now that you share parenting in common when your friends start having kids you may find them back in your life luckily my currently childless friends stuck with me and so grateful for that hope your friends adjust to your new life too what surprised me is that my friend of nearly 20 years who has year old disconnected from me she didnt even bother to message me once when was in the hospital had long stay with quite serious complications before and after birth have tried starting conversations with her several times in the past months but she has very quickly made the conversations fizzle out with short responses or switched the conversation to her own son as if she not interested in my life don talk about my son too much mention he doing well but that it since there not much to say but it feels as though she jealous that have child now anyone else have that experience we were the first in our friend groups to get married lost lot of immature friends and now that our son is only two months until arriving it happening again had one friend actually tell me in anger that they weren ready for me to be mother because was selfishly taking time away from our friendship to do it seriously immature people can handle people around them maturing it all it is we re working on finding friends that are either mature enough to get it or have babies of their own same here was the first as well months later some still keep in touch but there disconnect sadly one of the people that seem to have disappeared completely is was my best friend no mom friends yet but am planning on going to mom baby groups soon in hopes of meeting some for sure did have large group to begin with but the only ones that truly keep in touch are the ones who have kids none of them said anything about my daughter but it was basically slow drift honestly that first year is what did it in most of my time was dedicated to either tending to my daughter or working and could really give much time to going out and nobody wanted to hang out with new mom and her baby it helped making friends with other new moms maybe see if there moms club chapter in your area the one that had near me when my second was born was an amazing group of women and still connected to few since moving away good luck know how you feel also wonder if ever was bad friend or did something annoying or said something stupid in the two years that passed between the moment my friends had their first kids and the one did oh ya had to start all over and go to mom groups amp play dates it like dating again haha you got to put yourself out there bc other moms are in the same position people without kids can even fathom what it like so your common ground isn really there anymore they are great to go to hh with without kids but anything else they will prob stay away good luck with your journey and try not to take it too personally dad here but believe it happens to all of us honestly yup really struggling with this lately too my girl is 10 months too fit me it is also exacerbated by the fact that we moved away to more suburban neighborhood where we don have lot of friends so it been harder to see people want to make friends with moms in my neighborhood but don know how anyway know how you re feeling motherhood is lonely sometimes my best friend has done similar thing my baby is almost year old and has never held her she seen her once by accident at restaurant and that was the last time ve talked to her and tried to make an effort but know that our friendship is over have talked to her since january make plans to see my unencumbered friends one night week after my baby is asleep want to maintain the relationships so sacrifice bit of sleep for some good conversation and cheap wine also text them lot my baby is 18 months when she is older think my friends will be able to enjoy her company bit more my friends are wonderful but they are mostly focused on career right now support them in the ways can like checking in on work thing or new boyfriend they support me with break from baby world it has changed all that much we have always had very different lives they show up for birthdays and special occasions for my daughter am very lucky oh yes all my childless friends that told me over and over they would be there all the time to snuggle my baby disappeared when she was born thank god for mommy groups yea we did have the time do do stuff as much we do have people over about once month in th he evening so friends can see the baby for little bit before bedtime and that works out well if they are willing to come over to our place and we are always willing to host it is hard to take the baby work us everywhere and we want to keep him with consistent bed time so either we leave early after having to constantly wrangle curious toddler in house that is not baby proofed so we do get much time to visit or only one of us can go and that is crummy for the other person too we have done these but just prefer to keep it to minimum we do have several friends that do visit us but others who prefer as in only accept people to come to their house and my husband refuses to take child to house as messy theirs is because of the number of things that can go from floor to mouth and they have huge dog that is scared of strangers that my husband does not trust yep it very isolating have one friend childless with whom actually became lot closer and if it wasn for her don know what would do because all my other friends even the ones with kids pretty much dropped off the face of the earth after had my kiddo can tell you how many of my friends babysat for in college and beyond who have never returned the favor and made zero to no effort to spend time with my kid also got rid of all social media accounts around the same time became new parent this was almost four years ago and sure that had some impact on it as well very fortunate to be able to send my daughter to montessori school leading me to find my amazing mom group and finally having that type of support lost just about everyone after became pregnant and these who did leave after the pregnancy announcement left shortly after birth it took me year after birth to find the friends have now people suck lol the first in our friend group to have kid two of them never sent congrats or bothered to ask to see my baby when was on maternity leave it hurt lot since we were like family always in touch since middle school in my 30s now my baby is sixteen months now still not peep the way see it is gaining the parent identity came at cost of telling me whom to spend my limited time with wisely did my little man is months old it amazing how many turned up to the hospital when he was born versus now second this met one of my best mom friends on facebook mom group did have many before had my daughter just work friends we had just moved to new city so did really have the chance but once people found out was pregnant and after had the baby was never invited to anything do have any mom friends because work during the day and every mom group thing find is always at 10am on tuesday and really too shy to strike up friendship from the parents see at the weekend classes and things we do it really just the of us now right there with you it sad but then just remember that my husband still wants to hang right right all jokes aside we re getting ready to move out of state and very few of our friends even know maybe ll get motivated to make mom friends there especially when you have ppd yeah well depression will do that got antenatal depression that became postnatal depression made some mum friends during my year of maternity leave no time or energy to keep up with them since going back to work made some other mum friends that see sometimes at exercise class but have been going that often working and parenting just takes up all my time and energy given choice between hang in ng out with people or taking nap choose the nap every time not sad about it it just the way it is have also done this my husband would watch the baby so could go out with them however there seems to be no compromise on their side with wanting to be around my baby it upsetting didnt have many close friends before had kids but after had my daughter ended up making lot of mom friends some of them are closer friends than others but weve been going strong for nearly years now which has been great the biggest help for me was honestly facebook was about ready to delete my facebook before had my first kid but between keeping in touch with family and joining every relevant mom group could it was useful tool for me suggest looking up something like city name moms of 20xx babies also joined hike it baby and started going to free forest school events whenever possible add to that going to any consistent activity for while should bring you closer to some other moms my dad takes my kids to the library almost every day work and even he has made friends with many of the moms to the point where they will try to meet up when they can hey kid and will be at such and such park on thursday at 12 if you and granddaughter can make it lost my bestie too got text after gave birth and text on my bday that been it my daughter is now months no calls no other texts ok guess this is how it is the only one in my friends group who has child and own my own home nobody has contacted me since the birth of my child all that was said was congratulations from everyone and then silence however ve just started mom and tots class once week and have made friends there it was difficult since they re all like 10 years older than me but my mindset is more like theirs than my own friends 🤷🏼‍♀️ it sucks but life is like that there always times that things will be out of sync but it always works out ♥️ we lost our entire friend group when we had baby we were also the first they were still at the stage in their lives where doing cocaine in the bathroom at house party was acceptable my first kid is now almost and we have solid network of parent friends we like and regularly spend time with go out to playgroups library story times the park you will naturally meet other parents in the same stage of life as you you will meet some duds but also eventually you will meet your best parent friend making friends as an adult is lot like dating you got ta go through few bad playdates to find the ones you like had numerous people that ve been friends with for years delete me off social media without second thought as if me having child somehow negatively impacted their lives but what did find was that built stronger relationships with other friends especially those who also had ended up having children for sure had horrible ppd after my first honestly didn know if was going to make it through message me if you ever need to talk hugs my husband had ton of friends who do have kids over the other day and did even know how to talk with them your new tribe can be found in parks and coffee shops around 10 am this is peak toddler time but really any time of day at story time at your library maybe even track down local moms group on the fb or reddit it might take time it might not you be surprised at how many other moms like you there are looking for friends lot of my mom group is constantly searching for mom friends so keep looking your old friends will be there someday so maybe one day you can laugh but that is understandably hurtful you will find an awesome group of mom friends trust me
